input_text:
Job Title: Research Assistant II

Location: Louisville, KY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Department:

Location:

Health Sciences Center

Time Type:

Full time

Worker Type:

Regular

Job Req ID:

R103848

Minimum Requirements:

Associate's degree in a related field and one or more years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education, training and work experience. Grade 2.

Position Description:

This position requires an individual who will be able to carry out laboratory experiments for a project that aims to dissect the role of metabolic rewiring in the intrinsic and acquired resistance to chemo- and targeted therapies in lung cancer. Position is be expected to conduct high level research in the area of molecular cancer biology, which includes combining cell culture, molecular biology, biochemistry and animal models of human cancer.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 

Perform experimental research in the field of molecular cancer biology. This will include, but is not limited to, cell culture, protein biochemistry, molecular biology techniques, and metabolomics techniques. Perform design experiments and collect data with the consultation of PI. This position requires ordering, stocking, and reagent preparation. The person will be expected to maintain detailed and organized records. Perform animal experiments under the supervision of PI. Mouse experiments include drug administration via oral gavage and intraperitoneal injections, as well as tumor implantation. 

Preferred Qualifications:

The person should have some technical ability, proficient, and accurate in scientific experimentation and who exhibits initiative and is able to work independently when trained. The person will need to be able to work in a group environment and be of assistance to a number of research projects. The person should (after appropriate training, etc.) be able to work fairly independently with guidance from the PI or other senior members of the lab. 

The Brown Cancer Center encourages candidates to apply who have demonstrated capacity to create inclusive work environments, will work effectively on increasingly diverse teams, and will serve the increasingly diverse students we admit and want to attract.

Target Compensation Maximum:

$24.77

Target Compensation Minimum:

$16.51

Compensation Will Be Commensurate To Candidate Experience.

Equal Employment Opportunity

The University of Louisville is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, sex, age, color, national origin, ethnicity, creed, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, pregnancy, or veteran status. If you are unable to use our online application process due to an impairment or disability, please contact the Employment team at employment@louisville.edu or 502.852.6258.

Assistance and Accommodations

Computers are available for application submission at the Human Resources Department located at 215 Central Avenue, Ste 205 - Louisville, Kentucky 40208.

If you require assistance or accommodation with our online application process, please contact us by email at employment@louisville.edu or by phone 502-852-6258.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
